intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium apoldense, commonly known as the Apolden hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow flowers that are surrounded by pale green or white ray florets. Hieracium apoldense is often found in open habitats and is known for its ornamental value in horticulture.
